titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lingnan Foundation Records
titlestmt.author: Martha Lund Smalley

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday March 26, 2019 at 22:09

did.abstract: This collection is the official archives of the Lingnan Foundation, formerly known as the Trustees of Lingnan University, which is a grant-making independent organization that seeks to contribute to the advancement of higher education in South China. These records are a continuation of documentation found in Yale Divinity School Record Group No. 14, Archives of the Trustees of Lingnan University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Lingnan Foundation Records (RG 14A), Special Collections, Yale Divinity School Library

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Lingnan Foundation, formerly the Trustees of Lingnan University, was first incorporated in the State of New York in 1893 to support the development of a college in Canton (Guangzhou), China, which had begun to offer classes in 1888. This college later became Lingnan University.

After the change of government in China in 1949, the Arts and Sciences faculties of Lingnan University were merged with Sun Yat-sen (Zhongshan) University. From 1954 to 1979, the Trustees conducted their work primarily in Hong Kong with several colleges that became the Chinese University of Hong Kong, and later, with the institution that is now Lingnan University, Hong Kong.

In 1980, the Trustees resumed their activities in Guangzhou, principally with Sun Yat-sen (Zhongshan) University on the former Lingnan campus and, since 1988, with Sun Yat-sen (Zhongshan's) constituent, Lingnan (University) College.

The Lingnan Foundation considers Lingnan University, Hong Kong and Sun Yat-sen University, including Lingnan (University) College as partner institutions. The Foundation also supports institutions or organizations in the United States or elsewhere that reflect the Lingnan tradition or otherwise share the Foundation's objectives in developing and strengthening its partner institutions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These archives are a continuation of documentation found in Record Group No. 14, Archives of the Trustees of Lingnan University. There is some overlap between the two collections. The bulk of the material in this record group dates from 1980 to 2006. Series I, Board of Trustees Meetings, includes agendas, reports, minutes, and correspondence related to the bi-annual meetings of the Board. Series II, Board of Trustees Records, documents other activities of the Board, including trips to China and Hong Kong to visit partner organizations and administrative arrangements for the Trustees of Lingnan University/Lingnan Foundation. The Committee Records in Series III and Financial Records of Series V primarily document the financial and adminstrative aspects of the Lingnan Foundation while the Program Records in Series IV document the many programs that the Foundation has supported over the years. Correspondence of longtime Executive Director/President Douglas Murray, as well as of other organizational leaders, is found throughout the collection.
